name: The Boathouse Bosham

reviews.text: We stayed in the captains cabin which was a lovely room with double doors we could open as it was a very hot night. We had an amazing nights sleep, the beds were delightful, I must say, the most comfortable I have ever slept in and am contemplating buying one. The hosts were extremely friendly especially their dog! Would definitely stay again, very relaxing. Thank you

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in the Sail Loft for 3 nights. I had read a few reviews of this room as being like a "converted garage', I can honestly say it felt nothing whatsoever like a garage! The room was very well-appointed and clean and the bed was utterly fantastic...so comfortable in fact, that we were getting in it at 7.30pm just to relax!
reviews.title: Mixed views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the breakfast...in fact my daughter ate twice what she does at home...and then we fed our bread scraps to the beautiful Koi carp in the garden. Lorraine was really helpful and accommodating with my daughter (I understand they don't normally take children under 8, so i think we sneaked in under the radar) and was happy to help with information on buses etc.

reviews.text: I would happily recommend The Boathouse and would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: The couple running the B&B were friendly and helpful. The room was a good size (we were upgraded to a top floor room with sloping ceilings.) The room was clean, everything worked, and the breakfast was good. I'd stay again.
reviews.title: Nice stay, friendly people.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Boathouse for one night on a business trip, i rang about an hour before arriving to say that my partner just happened to be local and was it ok for him to come with me, Kevin was great and it was no problem at all. We found the accommodation to be excellent, spotlessly clean and also very welcoming. I would recommend the Boathouse and as for noisy its on a quiet lane and it did not bother us at all.
reviews.title: This is not 4star B and B as it is on a busy main road and the noise can be annoying in the garden and in the rooms.

reviews.text: Booked the Sussex Room for 2 nights to attend a friends wedding, but had to cancel one night due to my husbands poor health. On phoning the B&B, I was made to feel like I was making up a story and had only ever wanted to stay one night (2 night minimum enforced!). Having checked their website, I suggested I vacated the Sussex room and moved to the Fontwell room, which would suit myself and my 3 year old daughter as it was a twin and also it was slightly less expensive. Kevin agreed that he would market the Sussex Room for the 2 nights and also the Fontwell for one night. I agreed that should the Fontwell room not be sold that Friday night, I would pay for the 2 nights and just arrive early. That was agreed.
reviews.title: Unfortunate experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now just received an email, cancelling my stay. This means I have to find another hotel as near to Bosham as possible and travel late at night with a 3 year old in my car, rather than being able to get a taxi back to the B & B.
reviews.title: A little tired ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know this sounds like sour grapes, but I do feel as though I have been badly treated by Kevin and this is not how potential customers should be treated prior to arriving.
reviews.title: A Boathouse weekend

reviews.text: Our room was booked by Lorraine and she was extremely helpful and had even agreed to allow our 3 year old to stay, when they have a age limit of 8 years for children. She even called back to check her gender, so that the bed could be made up in pink or blue, how thoughtful.
reviews.title: Great rooms, good breakfast and convenient location

reviews.text: However, I should have realised something would go wrong, when our booking confirmation and check in details came through, adding £50 to the price for the extra bed., even when we had offered to bring our own! I double checked this via e-mail, but was told that it was correct as they had no facility to add a childs rate to their website booking facility!
reviews.title: Enjoyable walking break

reviews.text: Would highly recommend the bothouse. Will be retuning shortly. Had a lovely meal overlooking bosham harbour at the the anchor bleu which was excellent. The harbour is a ten minute walk through quiet countryside.
reviews.title: Great place to stay. Loved the garden with its secret niches.

reviews.text: We spent one night whilst working in Bosham and needed a good nights rest. The boathouse was just the place. Lovely rooms, breakfast and gardens. Very friendly couple. Already told the boss to book us their again if we get any more work around Portsmouth.
reviews.title: Brill!!!

reviews.text: Thank you Lorraine and Kevin. Kev and Mark, GRK Flood Defences
reviews.title: A priceless little gem when we least expected it

reviews.text: An unplanned stay in the area left us feeling very rejected as many places in West Wittering were fully booked. Thank God we say as we then stumbled upon the The Boathouse, specifically, The Sail Loft. The best blend of very comfortable and practical accommodation, where only the best will do, with good service, setting and ease of check in and departure. It also lives up to it's name and is modern yet timeless . The owners are clearly educated in how the likes of Claridges provide comfort in bed and bedding and the breakfast was yummy. What stays with me more than anything was the great vibe at that place.....so much so we were willing to put our money where our mouth was and return within a week. Enough about what we think....our 8 month old slept for 10 hours and there wasn't a cot in sight. Brilliant.
reviews.title: Lovely two days
Comfort and pretty gardens!
reviews.text: My sister and I had two lovely days staying at the boathouse. Plenty of choice for breakfast and Lorraine and Kevin were very pleasant. We enjoyed a glass of wine of an evening( bring your own) sitting on the patio as we were blessed with glorious weather. The gardens were a pleasure to sit in.

description: The Boathouse is ideally situated for exploring and visiting a wealth of local sites and venues. Historical Bosham Church and Quay are within 2km walking distance. Chichester is just a few minutes drive away, or why not take advantage of the bus that stops a few yards down the road? If you are feeling energetic, you might enjoy the local cycle path from Emsworth to Chichester, which passes right outside. This superbly renovated, six-bedroomed house offers 4 guest rooms. All of these ground floor bedrooms are independently accessed and therefore provide private and secure B&B accommodation.
